snippet: Government forces killed at least eight people in the Yarmouk district of Damascus and reportedly drove dozens of formerly pro-government Palestinian fighters to defect to the rebels.
abstract: Government forces for first time strike largest Palestinian refugee neighborhood in Damascus, Syria, killing at least eight people and reportedly driving dozens of formerly pro-government Palestinian fighters to defect to rebels; new signs emerge of political pressure on Pres Bashar al-Assad to explore ways out of the crisis.

byline.original: By an EMPLOYEE of THE NEW YORK TIMES in SYRIA and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times reported from Damascus, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai.

lead_paragraph: Government forces killed at least eight people in the Yarmouk district of Damascus and reportedly drove dozens of formerly pro-government Palestinian fighters to defect to the rebels.

headline.main: A Syrian Airstrike Kills Palestinian Refugees and Costs Assad Support
headline.print_headline: A Syrian Airstrike Kills Palestinian Refugees and Costs Assad Support

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
